results.title: The story of fashion. Vol. 3: The Age of dissent
results.creator_credit: Roberta Guerra, Eila Hershon and RM Arts
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Phaidon art collection”.
In the third of this three part series, Karl Lagerfeld as presenter discusses the history of fashion in the 20th Century focussing on ‘The age of dissent’, the 60’s and beyond. Lagerfeld enlightens with commentary the archival footage of fashions from the last forty years with interviews of respected seniors of the industry such as; Ralph Lauren, Issy Miyaki, Mary Quant, Ballenciaga, John Crancher, Georgio Armani, Ralph Lauren and more. In emphasis is the shift from a controlled environment to one that defines the day of ‘anything goes’. Explored is the change in attitude toward the making, showing and promotion of fashion since the sixties, a change that has developed from social conditions and lifestyle. From the ultimate dissent of ‘Punk’ to the sleek and subtle work of Jean Muir, this program celebrates design in a time where the lines between art and fashion have blurred and an increase of cultural exchange has fashioned a diffusion of styles.
results.title_for_label: The story of fashion. Vol. 3: The Age of dissent
results.creator_credit_for_label: Roberta Guerra, Eila Hershon and RM Arts

results.title: The Story of fashion. Vol. 1: Remembrance of things past
results.creator_credit: Roberta Guerra, Eila Hershon and RM Arts
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Phaidon art collection”.
In the first episode of this three part series, Karl Lagerfeld discusses the history of fashion from its rise in the eighteenth and nineteenth centuries to the present day. Lagerfeld’s commentary, layered over a backdrop of fashion illustrations and archival footage, provides a broad survey of the evolution of this fascinating industry. The film begins by introducing the work of Charles Worth, inventor of haute couture and explores the changes of fashion over time to the work of some of the leading designers of today: Donna Karan; Fendi; Versace; Ralph Lauren; Valentino. Other areas that are discussed through interviews with leading industry players include dressmaking, fur, embroidery, hats, hairstyles, magazines and advertising techniques. Commentary written by Meredith Etherington-Smith and spoken by Diana Quick.

results.title: The Story of fashion. Vol 02: the art and sport of fashion
results.creator_credit: Roberta Guerra, Eila Hershon and RM Arts
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Phaidon art collection”.
In the second episode of this three part series presented by Karl Lagerfeld, the influence of film and television stars within fashion is discussed. From the designers who outfitted Claudette Colbert, Joan Crawford and Josephine Baker to Nolan Miller, head costume designer for “Dynasty”. The rise of the celebrity role model and the creation of a certain style is also explored. It highlights the influence of individual designers such as Jean Patou and Coco Chanel and also examines the relationship between fashion style and history, art and photography. Includes interviews with Pierre Cardin and other leading industry players.

results.title: The Story of Eric
results.brief_description: Follows the story of Wendy Johnston from the eighth month of her pregnancy to the birth of her first child, a son, Eric. Wendy and her husband Richard are seen attending classes in the Lamaze method of prepared childbirth, and practising the breathing exercises at home. As a result, wendy is in complete control of her body during labour and is fully aware of the experience.

As a result, wendy is in complete control of her body during labour and is fully aware of the experience.

results.title: The Story of English. Parts 1-4
results.brief_description: Prog 1 - An English speaking world; Prog 2 - The Mother Tongue Prog 3 - A Muse of Fire; Prog 4 - The Guide Scots Tongue. A Nine Part series that tells the story of English as a spoken language: how it started and survived, spread and developed. “The Story of English” spans more than 1,000 years of world history and visits locations on five continents. It presents a picture of the English speaking world and English speaking peoples of many nationalities and backgrounds.
results.description: Prog 1 - An English speaking world; Prog 2 - The Mother Tongue Prog 3 - A Muse of Fire; Prog 4 - The Guide Scots Tongue. A Nine Part series that tells the story of English as a spoken language: how it started and survived, spread and developed. “The Story of English” spans more than 1,000 years of world history and visits locations on five continents. It presents a picture of the English speaking world and English speaking peoples of many nationalities and backgrounds.

results.title: The Story of English furniture. Part 1
results.creator_credit: BBC, Paul Smith and Robin Drake
results.brief_description: Arthur Negus and Hugh Scully tell the fascinating story of English furniture from its very beginnings to the 18th century. They demonstrate the all-important points of design and detail which make it easier to date furniture and to tell the difference between the original and the fake or copy. Part one of this two part program consists of 4 segments: Medieval and Elizabethan; Jacobean and Restoration; William and Mary; Queen Anne and Early Georgian.

results.title: The Story of Elizabeth Hayward
results.brief_description:
After stealing seven shilling’s worth of silk, Elizabeth Hayward gets sent to Australia in chains. She recounts, in a letter to her parents, her horrific journey and experience of malnutrition and violent treatment of convicts by white colonials and of her desire to be back home with her parents.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: The Story of EC
results.creator_credit: Patricia Edgar and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lift off”.
Four stories that tell how EC came to live with Nipper Poss and Kim. “A Load of old rubbish”: A scruffy old doll called EC falls off a dump truck and is rescued and cleaned by Poss and Kim. “Out of order”: Nipper loses EC in the rain and EC disappears down the drain. “Clash”: Poss and Kim argue over EC’s role in a game and pull the doll apart. “Destroy”: Nipper thinks he is too old for dolls and tries to reject EC.

results.title: The Story of diplomacy
results.creator_credit: John Martin-Jones, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Ian Dunlop
results.brief_description: Traces the history of diplomacy from the days of early Greek and Egyptian civilization. The establishment of resident ambassadors abroad, the introduction of congresses and the “balance of power”, the revolt against secrecy after World War I, resulting in the League of Nations and later the United Nations. Emphasises the continuing importance of individual negotiations. Narrated by Alastair Duncan.

results.title: The Story of cricket in Australia (Captioned)
results.brief_description: From the time of the first test, through days of aboriginal teams visiting England, the drama of the bodyline series, and the 1977 World Cricket Series Revolution, Australians have always been ‘cricket mad’. Jack Egan brings together cricket greats to recall highlights of their career, as well as using magnificent archival footage. Special appearances by Ian Chappell, Bill O’Reilly and Ray Lindwall.
